ovdesc.p: Application to define the target files to be checked when a script is uploaded.

desc.p: Possible inputs are UPDATE,DELETE and NO.UPDATE. Default value is UPDATE.
This field will get populated with the Date on which the SEAT.SCRIPT.RESULT.FILES reocrd was modified and uploaded to the master. This is an NOINPUT field.
Only Dates can be defined as value for this field
A valid transaction ID of the above application. This is a no input field.
Free text as description. Between 3 and 35 characters allowed, no special editing will be done.
Stores the overall result of the script. This is a noinput field.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
This field will be updated as 'ERROR', when the OVERALL.RESULT field in SEAT.SCRIPT.FORMAT.OUTPUT record is set as 'ERROR' for the Enquiry Reports/Deal Slip messages.
This field can have any Alphanumeric characters.
This field will have the SEAT.SCRIPT.FORMAT.OUTPUT record ID, when the Application in the script is Enquiry Reports/Deal slips messgaes.This field can accept any Alphanumeric characters
Mandatory field which accepts free text as description. This field can have a maximum of 35 characters
This should be a valid ID to link to the file name defined above. The record ids can be defined in below manner:
1. The record ID can be the transaction ID itself e.g. SCRIPT035000001.
2. Can be hard coded values within quotes e.g. "SYSTEM" or 'SYSTEM'.
3. Can be formed using a routine e.g. @SSF.SEC.TRADE.POSN.ID.
4. If the field is left blank then the system assumes that only one file is updated and gets the value of RECORD ID from the after image of the transaction
5. Can be valid field of the base application. If it is a multivalue or subvalue field then it needs to be specified for example FIELD.NAME:1:1
This field can have a maximum of 85 characters.
A valid Application name.
Up to 35 characters of input will be accepted, leading spaces, trailing spaces and duplicated embedded spaces will be removed.
This fields holds the ACCOUNTING.UPDATES.ID.The Account updates ID will be usually in the following format 'SCRIPT.FUNCTION*ACCOUNTING'. This field is not in use any more.
e.g. SCRPTXXXXXXXX-X*ACCOUNTING
A valid date, either SCRIPT.FUNCTION or COB.DATE or TSA.SERVICE name should exist in each multivalue set.
SCRIPT.FUNCTION is in SCRPT06023033139-03-A or SCRPT06023033139-03-I
The COB.DATE is in YYYYMMDD-EOD or YYYYMMDD-SOD format.
Valid TSA.SERVICE name should be given, like BNK/SC.CORPORATE.ACTIONS
This field will get updated with the Date on which the SEAT.SCRIPT.RESULT.FILES record was created and uploaded to the master. This is an NOINPUT field.
Only Dates can be defined as value for this field
Stores the valid SCRIPT.ID and the function with the delimiter as "-", format is : 'SCRIPT.ID-FUNCTION' i.e. 'SCPRT0350001000-1-I'.
Validation has been done to include only the SCRIPT.ID in the first part and valid FUNCTIONS like I,A,D,R,V in the second part.
Valid company ID
Stores the result per SCRIPT.FUNCTION defined. This is a NOINPUT field.

A valid SEAT.SCRIPT.RESULT.FIELD.VALUES ID. If it is not defined then id is defaulted automatically as FILE.NAME*SCRIPT.FUNCTION(or COB.DATE whichever is given)*1(or 2 or 3, depending on how many times a filename is used in the sub value.)
This field can have a maximum of 55 characters.
ID should be a valid SCRIPT.ID from SEAT.SCRIPTS.
Up to 35 characters of input will be accepted, leading spaces, trailing spaces and
duplicated embedded spaces will be removed.
This is a No input field that will get updated with value as NEW when a Script is uploaded in to the Master area.
This field holds the Base Release of the script, which is updated from the SEAT.SCRIPTS record.This field can have any Alphanumeric characters

A valid file name to be given. This also accepts an ID when the EXPECTED result is to be built. The format is FILE.NAME*FILE.ID i.e. LMM.ACCOUNT.BALANCES*LD00100000100. Validation has been done to check the delimeters and the parameters.
Mandatory input.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
